item.title: How to diet and actually be happy about it
item.itunes:title: How to diet and actually be happy about it
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

¬†

¬†

What if you spent each day purposely thinking about your future healthy lifestyle? Yes. I'm talking you at your goal or you 30lbs. from now.

¬†

Each day you specifically set aside time to think positively during your car rides, walks, or waiting in line at stores. You dream about the amazing things you will think about, feel and do when you reach your goal.¬†

¬†

I'm just going to take a wild guess here and say you spend NON-purposeful time in the brain toilet sometimes.¬†

¬†

If you are like me, you don't always bathe in luxurious thoughts. It's more like, "Why can't you get your act together," type thinking.

¬†

People think I'm crazy or moan at how pie-in-the-sky it is to think amazing things on purpose.

¬†

Then, we complain that we have an inner bully.¬†

¬†

Ladies. You want to fix the problem or not? You are going to think. We know that. Let's just start being more deliberate with it so we can get what we want. OUR GOALS!

¬†

One of the best things you can do for yourself when it comes to weightloss is to learn how to fill your brain with purposeful, good thoughts.

¬†

Guess what? When you do that you squeeze out time for non-purposeful harmful thoughts. This doesn't mean the old crap goes away. Doing the deliberate, nice talk just means you are at least evening out the playing field.

¬†

When you create a goal, you must picture yourself reaching that goal. Let's say you set a goal weight. What do you do at that weight? How do you feel? What do you look like?

¬†

Today's podcast dives deep in how to think more about where you are going than hating where you are.

¬†

It's a key to weightloss so you better listen up.

¬†¬†

¬†

item.description:

¬†

In this week's podcast, I talk about how much I love the book Atomic Habits, by James Clear.

I'm all about some personal development y'all, and this book is off the charts.

He defines atomic habits as the super small steps you take in order to reach your goal. I've preached this for a while. It's the small steps forward that add up to big wins.

We also look into the difference between the goal you set and the system you have in place that makes the goal.¬†

Listen up and I'll tell you all about how to create a system that works for YOU.

In today's podcast we help you figure out how BAD you want to lose your weight.

¬†

Most anyone with weight to lose has an easy time wishing or hoping they can loss some weight. They look on pinterest for the next best plan, but it's only the folks who are ready to do the work that actually start doing things they don't want to do in order to reach their goal.

¬†

When you decide that today's the day and you're ready to do hard things, it's time to commit to what you WILL do that you don't WANT to do, like say no to the cheetos and the extra slice of pizza.

item.title: Defining Failure So You Can Lose Weight
item.itunes:title: Defining Failure So You Can Lose Weight
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

One of my favorite concepts to teach people is failure. In this episode I'm going to show you two different types of failures and how you use them to lose weight.

¬†

Escape failures are changing what you do based on a feeling. It's like when you quit following your plan for the day because you overate lunch. it's giving up and hiding.

¬†

Worthy failures are recognizing that even though you didn't get the result you wanted, there's something to learn from what happened.¬†

¬†

Today we talk to you about how to accept that failure is part of progress.¬†

¬†

¬†

¬†

item.title: How to Stop Failing at Weightloss
item.itunes:title: How to Stop Failing at Weightloss
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

¬†

I remember crazy diets I tried hoping this would be the one that would work.

The Military Diet was my favorite. It had tuna and ice cream on it. You ate this crazy mix for three days and then you eat ‚Äúnormally‚Äù for four.

If I knew how to eat normally I wouldn‚Äôt be on the Military Diet!

That‚Äôs the problem with your past diets. They expect you to just wake up on Monday, get your emotional eating act together and VOILA! You lose weight.

We are hosed year after year by the diet industry. This time of year is THE WORST.

You are seeing all the ads that promise MAJOR weightloss and this amazing happy life that will be the result of pre-packaged meals and a gym membership.

IF YOU DON‚ÄôT READ ANYTHING ELSE PLEASE READ THIS.

They are counting on your desperation to lose weight. They will tell you about pills, shakes, meal plans, and more to convince you that weightloss is fast and easy.

What they don‚Äôt understand is that when you eat chips and ice cream at 8pm has nothing to do with being hungry.

I know back when I weighed 250lbs I ate because I was TIRED and desperately wanted some me time.

If you are like me, no shake makes you feel cared for and deserving of quiet time. Pills don‚Äôt take away feelings of stress and overwhelm from another day of not getting it all done.

I tried these diets and FAILED them time after time. I felt like a failure.

If you feel me then know this‚Ä¶

All that‚Äôs happened is the diet industry has set you up year after year to fail. YOU ARE NOT A FAILURE.

Today‚Äôs podcast is key. You are going to learn how to release feeling like failure and start believing you can lose your weight.

You will love how we take you though a simple process to release the feelings of failure, examine what happened in the past and feel confident about trying to lose weight again. It‚Äôs my new years gift to you. Enjoy.

¬†

¬†

item.title: Why do you want to lose weight?
item.itunes:title: Why do you want to lose weight?
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†¬†

To be hot.

To be the 80 year old who twerks and doesn‚Äôt throw a hip.

To stop the obesity gene in my family.

To never need the seat belt extender on an airplane.

To say good-bye to Lane Bryant forever.

To nag Chris until we‚Äôre in our 90‚Äôs.

These were just a few of my reasons to lose 100lbs.

They still feel good to this day, and each reason keeps me focused in maintenance.

Finding your why‚Äôs and reasons are so important. There are simply times you will want to eat off plan.

Pizza on a Friday with your family after a long, hard week will sound AMAZING.

Your why‚Äôs will need to be stronger than your desire to throw down four slices with a glass of wine.

In the podcast you will hear a lot of good why‚Äôs you can borrow, how to make your own list and when to use the why‚Äôs so you can lose your weight for good.

¬†

¬†

Are you confused by how to set a realistic weightloss goal? You aren't alone.

The diet industry promises MAJOR pounds lost and delivers big disappoint. Why? They set you up to think weightloss should be fast and exciting.

If you are ready to learn how to be the person who sets their weightloss goal, makes daily choices that keep you losing weight, and feels confident you'll lose your weight then listen up.

item.title: How to Make Sure Your Jeans Fit on January 1
item.itunes:title: How to Make Sure Your Jeans Fit on January 1
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

Today we talk about how to navigate this month with your RESULT in mind.

Take a minute and think about how you want to FEEL on January 1.

Then think about what might get in your way as you work through your holiday planning and eating and how you'll work through those things.

The beauty of planning ahead of time is that you can create an action plan that anticipates all contingencies. And when you execute that plan, the results come into reach.

Kathy and I talk today about how WE want to feel on January 1 and how we'll go about getting there. We also refer to last year's December 14th podcast titled Good, Better, Best where I talk about working through the holidays successfully.

The holidays are supposed to be all about cheer and goodwill. Instead you might be making it be a time you whip out your biggest excuses to overeat, give up until the new year, or throw in the towel because it's too hard to lose weight at Christmas.¬†

The currency for weightloss is NOT paid in excuses. You have to pay with your commitment and focus. Today I motivate and preach about how to get your mind right and stay on plan.

item.title: All The Reasons People Offer You Food
item.itunes:title: All The Reasons People Offer You Food
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

Food pushers. These are the people in your life who always offer food.

"Don't you want some of this?"

"Why aren't you eating?"

"I made this just for you!"

If you don't know what a food pusher is, go back and listen to Episode 34 - Handling Holiday Food Pushers.

In todays episode we dig in to WHY these people may be offering you food. They may want to feel love, or connected to you; or they may want to feel justified in their own choices.

Whatever the reason, we help you find ways to answer the food pushers in your life in a way that leaves you feeling good about your choice.

item.title: What do you do when you feel terrible?
item.itunes:title: What do you do when you feel terrible?
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

I don't feel good today. And I tell you all about it in today's podcast.

Some of you will be like me and just get mad when you don't feel good. Others will feel sad and just shut down. And a lot of us will turn to food to make us feel better.

Today we talk about really noticing your habits when you don't feel well. We teach you how to pause and ask yourself to be honest about what you really need. Sometimes it's rest, sometimes it's easier tasks, but it's usually not chocolate or cheetos or ice cream.

When I lost 100lbs, it was all about me undoing years and years of failed diets and twisted thinking that I had to be MISERABLE to lose weight.

I remember so many times catching myself wanting to complicate weightloss. I'd sit around thinking that making small changes would never be enough.

What was different for me this time?

I am giving you two key things you must know. Use them. Don't let this just be "interesting." I want you to stop what you are doing and write how you can start using these two keys TODAY.

We wrote down more than eighty of them during our three days together. I share some of my favorites in this episode.

item.title: How To Stop Eating When It Tastes So Good
item.itunes:title: How To Stop Eating When It Tastes So Good
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

How many times have you reached satisfied and been mad about it? You hear the negotiations in your head - "It tastes so good." "I worked so hard to fix this." "But it's healthy."

Food is supposed to taste good. But using food to avoid feeling is a habit you may have created. We talk about how habits are formed in the brain and how we are normal for having them.

Listen in for tips on recognizing when you are using food to avoid feelings or even when you are repeating thoughts about food that are leading to overeats.

Why was I the special snowflake that lost her 100lbs and kept it off? How was someone like me able to not only lose the weight but teach women? In this special episode I go into why I think I'm different and how it not any different than you.

item.itunes:title: Other Peoples' Opinions
item.description:

https://phit.click/freecourse

Have you ever thought about the real reason you won't pull the trigger on a big decision?

You think it's because you're worried about what someone else will think or say, when it's actually more about what you're thinking about yourself.

In today's episode, we talk about how important it is that you find happiness, excitement, and acceptance from within rather than look for it from the people in your life.

Your internal validation and acceptance of yourself is way more important and meaningful. Listen in and we'll tell you why.

item.itunes:title: Why You Set Goals
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†Today's episode is all about goal setting.

You know your goal is dead on if it brings up a bunch of fearful thinking.

When I set a goal, if I don't immediately feel doubt, overwhelm, and fear, I know my goal isn't aggressive enough. And y'all know me! I set a goal and I'm all in.

Why do you set a goal? To give yourself something to work toward, something to grow by. It's a move forward to achieving things you never dreamed you'd achieve. And if it doesn't feel scary sometimes, you aren't dreaming big enough.

¬†

In the third part of our three part series on finding your groove in your weight loss, we talk about why you get irritated with the thoughts you might be thinking about food.

There's nothing wrong with getting urges to overeat or eat off plan. If you are feeling the urge, you're normal! The urges will always be around. Resisting the urge only makes it louder.

Today we'll go over some common thoughts and urges and how to recognize them and deal with them.

Someone asked me recently "How long does it take for things to click?"

You have to start moving in to ACTION in order for things to start happening. Just hanging out waiting, or even just consuming information, doesn't brings things together for you. Not until you try new things, nail some basic concepts, and create some new evidence do your weightloss efforts start to come together and build success.

In this podcast, I talk about what happens, or doesn't happen, when you sit around waiting for your weight loss to start feeling easy.

item.title: Clean Out Those Fat Skinny Clothes with Shira Gill
item.itunes:title: Clean Out Those Fat Skinny Clothes with Shira Gill
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

Do you hang onto clothes that don't flatter your body?

Here's what I see often.

You keep the "fat clothes" as you lose weight just in case you gain weight.

You keep the skinny clothes or "just a few more pounds" clothes because getting rid of them means you've given up.
OMG both of these reasons STINK! Here's why.

When you keep clothes that don't feel good, you are forced each day to think about what you are most afraid of...FAILING! You open your closet and your brain immediately goes to all the ways you aren't good enough or good enough to keep the weight off.

No wonder the day starts poorly, right?

Well, I decided to bring Shira Gill on the podcast today. She's a life coach who helps you understand how to create a closet and style that helps you look and feel your best REGARDLESS of your size.

Just starting to lose weight? She gives you easy and cheap tips to look amazing with the clothes you have now.

Lost a lot of weight? She helps you make the break from hanging onto your old clothes

Losing weight and looking at a lot of "I used to wear clothes?" She offers you a way to keep some pieces and toss the rest.

I LOVED talking to her and I know you will love listening to her.

If you want to visit her website (it's gorgeous) go to www.shiragill.com. She's got a free 15 min. makeover that will kickstart some organizing and purging!

¬†

¬†

item.title: Finding The Reason You Want To Lose Weight
item.itunes:title: Finding The Reason You Want To Lose Weight
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

I've recently been working with my Tribe on finding out the reason WHY they want to lose weight. It's so important to understand yourself enough to know why you're doing this work and what exactly it is that you want to create in your life.

For me, I just want to look great. Others want to be healthy. Some want to play with grandchildren. Finding your WHY helps you remain focused on the person you want to become, especially when you're sitting across the table from your husband eating a pizza.

Your WHY doesn't take away cravings, but it does help you remember the decision you want to make in the moment that gets you closer to the person you want to be.

In this episode, I talk about why it's so important for find your WHY, and how you go about figuring it out.

¬†

item.title: Why You Eat When You're Tired
item.itunes:title: Why You Eat When You're Tired
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

I recently got a comment on my blog from a girl who said she struggles staying on plan when she's tired. She said it's just harder to stay on plan and falls into telling herself she can eat something crappy "just this once."

There are a couple of reasons this comes up. You can be just physically tired. When you're physically tired, your thoughts may be like "hey we should eat to keep up our energy!"

You could also be emotionally tired and just need a break. We live in an over-stimulating world and sometimes you just have to shut down for a bit.

In this podcast we help you identify which one it is for you, how it shows up, and what to do with it to prevent eating when you just don't need to.

item.title: When Exercise Feels Hard
item.itunes:title: When Exercise Feels Hard
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

I had a client ask me recently what to do when exercise feels hard. She wants to be an athlete, but she still has a lot of weight to lose. She works out then is laid up for days. She has the drive and the will, but her body is not quite ready to do what she really wants.

This is how I started. I had always wanted to be an athlete. But at 250 pounds and first starting out, all I could do was a 10 minute walk. And that's okay.

In this podcast I talk about meeting yourself where you are and leveling up a little at a time. That's exactly what I did. I went from walking 10 minutes at a time to running marathons and power lifting. You can too.

¬†

item.title: Why Bother With Another Diet
item.itunes:title: Why Bother With Another Diet
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†¬†

Justifications. These are the excuses we throw up to talk ourselves out of doing what we know we should be doing to lose weight.

Our excuses get us off our game and set up roadblocks to our goals. They take our focus off what we really want and put the focus on what we can have in the moment.

We have a member who posted about how she didn't want to plan her food because she didn't know what she'd feel like eating and didn't want to box herself in. This is the crap she tells herself so she can eat whatever she wants in the moment!

Listen in while I show you how your excuses and justifications are derailing your weight loss efforts.

¬†

Women of all ages and fitness levels trained together and raced together, some of them for the very first time, proving that all it takes is a goal and the drive to succeed to do anything you put your mind to.

And every single one of them finished, some with laughter and some with tears. It was a beautiful day.

item.itunes:title: Loose Skin
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

I get so many requests to talk about loose skin that I decided it's time to get real about it here on the podcast.

Losing a lot of weight will undoubtedly result in some loose skin. I have some! I've taken care of some of it with surgery and I've left some behind. But the most important thing I've done is looked at my own judgements of how my body looks, loose skin and all.

In this podcast I share my journeys with loose skin, the physical journey and the emotional one.

Good planning just doesn't happen without first assessing what went right and what needs improvement.

And the key to an effective assessment is to make sure you are doing it without regret, judgement, and shame.

We teach you all about how and when to do your best assessment in this episode.

item.title: Getting Ready For The Weekend
item.itunes:title: Getting Ready For The Weekend
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

Today we begin our three part series on weekends. We start with the importance of creating a weekend plan. This plan needs to be doable and realistic. It needs to be something you know you will successfully complete.

Part of creating this plan is visualizing! Think about what you'll eat, where you'll eat it, and who you are eating it with! Think about what you'll say and do when someone calls to ask you to go out. And think about how great you'll feel at the end of the weekend when you know you've banged it out of the park.

Listen in for some great tips for planning an amazing weekend.

¬†

item.title: Keeping The Newness
item.itunes:title: Keeping The Newness
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

In today's broadcast I talked how important it is that you keep the newness when losing weight. So often we assume we HAVE to go from everything being easy to it all being too hard to do. Guess what? Whatever thought you have about it when it is easy to make the right food choices you can use when problems appear. I'll teach you how in this training.

item.title: Why Can't I Stay On Plan?
item.itunes:title: Why Can't I Stay On Plan?
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

I get this question ALL THE TIME. Why do I keep quitting? Why can't I stay on plan?

Here's what happens. We just start to get sloppy. We don't do our food journals, we skip exercise, or we grab some chips.

These are called little quits. And guess what. Little quits add up to big quits, and all of a sudden you're not losing weight. You're in maintenance mode and you don't know why.

Today we talk about why we do this and how to clean them up.

item.title: A Weight Loss Plateau Doesn't Mean Failure
item.itunes:title: A Weight Loss Plateau Doesn't Mean Failure
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

One week of not losing weight is not a stall and it's not a catastrophe! Your body is an amazing creation - it could be just adjusting to your new life or getting ready to do a big fat dump!

When your body doesn‚Äôt release weight for a week, it‚Äôs not stalled, It‚Äôs doing things on the inside. It‚Äôs all about the chemistry that‚Äôs setting you up to release a good amount at one time. If you get frustrated and have a week when you eat your face off, you‚Äôve just negated the work your body is doing.

Today's podcast gives great tips on how to handle your plateau emotionally, and how to get your weight loss re-started.

item.title: How Do You Throw Away Food and Not Clean Your Plate While Dieting?
item.itunes:title: How Do You Throw Away Food and Not Clean Your Plate While Dieting?
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

Think about this. To lose weight you MUST be willing to eat just enough. You have to learn how to eat until satisfied. No one who "stuffs themselves" or is a card carrying member of the Clean Plate Club is going to lose weight easy.

To lose weight you have to be able to leave food behind.

Restaurants will over serve you, your mom will insist you have more, if you order pizza you get a better deal when you buy two, and sometimes even what you prepare yourself is just too much for that meal.

Your inability to "waste" food will make losing weight harder. You just can't overeat and expect losses.

When I work with clients I ask them how often they are overeating. A lot of them think overeating is limited to a binge-fest on a bad day.

Nope! In fact, for most of us, that's the LEAST damaging. Give-up moments are easy to spot.

What's elusive and often WAY harder to stop is the justified overeating.

"I"m full, but I portioned this so I should finish it."

"It's just a couple of bites left in the pan."

"OOOHHH a bite of Mac and Cheese left on juniors plate."

"I hate to waste the food...I paid for it."

"It's free! I'm broke so I need to take advantage."

All of this is waste. Waste going straight to your waist.

When you overeat you aren't saving money or getting your money's worth.

Overeating wastes your mental energy day dreaming about losing weight, it wastes your time on this earth toting around too many pounds, and it wastes your ability to know how much food you need.

One interesting concept I was teaching a Tribe member the other day was that you will NEVER know how much food to buy at the store if you keep polishing off food that you aren't hungry for. Think of the money you waste over-buying each week!

If you have head drama over leaving food behind OK. That's fine. Have some head drama but toss the food. Toss the food knowing you are teaching yourself how to quit wasting time wanting to lose weight. You will eventually teach yourself how much food you need and probably start buying less.

In this podcast we talk about how to put into practice leaving food behind deliberately.

Trust me. I still work on leaving food behind. When I do I think someone should march in with confetti and celebrate. Even after 13 years of keeping my weight off I feel like not cleaning my plate is an amazing feat. I don't know if wasting food will ever feel natural but I'm OK with that. I kind of like this body and willing to just keep working at it.

Plus, maybe that confetti will erupt. I sure hope I get a selfie.

¬†

item.title: Two Things I Changed to Lose Weight
item.itunes:title: Two Things I Changed to Lose Weight
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

Today we are going deeper into the brain and the process of weightloss. Most people don't know why they sabotage themselves with weightloss. It's because we aren't looking at what we make losing weight mean. Are you defining dieting as being "terrible, restrictive, losing your social life?" If so, you will have a hard time creating a realistic plan and following it. It won't feel right. This is just one of the things we discuss and this conversation is important to losing your weight for good. How I viewed my weightloss journey was everything for me when I finally lost 100 pounds.

item.title: What we've learned about ourselves and each other in the first 50
item.itunes:title: What we've learned about ourselves and each other in the first 50
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

HOLY CRAP it's episode 50!

As we were thinking about this episode, we decided to look at the evolution of the podcast and the evolution we've seen in ourselves.

One of us is a talker and the other is a planner. Can you guess which is which? But here's the funny thing - the one who talks actually plans more and the one who plans actually gets in front of the mike and talks!

I've watched the coaches on my team think outside the box and question what they believed about themselves.

I've watched the four of us as team members grow and change and refocus our lives in a way that serves women who want to lose their physical and mental weight.

It's been a tremendous year of growth...growth in knowledge and even more in self-confidence and self-awareness.

And the podcast has allowed me to connect to people in a way I've never been able to imagine. I've brought you problems and solutions, coaching moments and applause, and laughter and tears.

It's taught me to quit trying to please everyone and to try to change the person's life who needs me right now. It's shown me how to show up for the person who identifies with me and all my sass and vinegar, and a few tears now and then too.

My purpose is to change people's lives. I've studied more so I can teach more. I've worker harder so I can be present for my Tribe. And I've loved every stinking minute of it.

So what will we create in the next 50? Where will we be and where will the Tribe be? We are creating goals, plans and actions so that every woman feels as good physically and mentally as I do. Dream big, baby. I am - lunch with Oprah is at the top of the list.

¬†¬†

item.title: You don't need confidence to lose weight...here's what you need!
item.itunes:title: You don't need confidence to lose weight...here's what you need!
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

So often we get hung up on wanting to feel confident, motivated, and more to lose weight. Those are advanced feeling skills that come with PRACTICE and REPETITION of doing things. So what do you need? Courage. That's the best skill to use when you start losing weight. Why? Because it won't be easy, you will make mistakes, and you will have to learn a lot. That takes courage. This episode teaches you how to get that courage.

¬†¬†

item.title: How to Change Your Thoughts So You Can Change Your Life
item.itunes:title: How to Change Your Thoughts So You Can Change Your Life
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

Today I talk about the time in my life when I decided to take responsibility for my life and my weight. I had to start really understanding WHY I was eating and really examining what benefits I found in overeating.

The brain seeks pleasure to avoid pain. The problem with this is that we EAT to avoid the pain in our life.

Why is THAT a problem?

Because food doesn't comfort you. There's no benefit to eating through pain. It's the habits that you create to avoid the pain that are the real painful part. And it's the extra weight that you carry around that causes the pain.

Then the realization hits. The way you are living is more painful then the pleasure you are finding in food.

Logan was a baby. When I took a good look at my life at 29, I realized that this was not what I wanted for him. I didn't want him to go through the depression and the bullying. I decided it was time to make my old lifestyle as painful and unappealing as possible.

So how do you do that?

You just start telling yourself the truth about what your eating is really doing to you. In the moment, it makes you forget - it gives you temporarily relief. But what it really does is give you shame, a bloated belly, and a body that hurts to move.

You have to quit making it seem like food is the answer or food is your best friend. It may be giving you temporary relief, but it's not doing anything for you long term.

¬†

¬†

item.title: Self-Care Isn't Just Baths!
item.itunes:title: Self-Care Isn't Just Baths!
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

I'm a busy lady just like you. I can tell you one thing:I attract women who get a lot done and feel they have no time left for themselves.

That's why I want to talk about self-care a minute.

I decided a long time ago that self-care was not optional. But, I also don't define it like most people.

Self-care, for me, is taking time each day to clean out my brain. I need to know what's going on in there that needs re-directing. Just because I wake up in a sour mood doesn't mean the day is shot. It means I need to ask myself to generate the feelings I want for the day.

¬†

To me planning and assessing is self-care. The ultimate form of self-care is my mental health. Knowing I am prepared for my day, thought ahead, decided how I was going to show up for the world is the best gift I give myself.

Sure I get my hair done, go out to dinner every now and then, but the real form of self-care I love is taking a few minutes to just figure out how I am CHOOSING to show up each day in thought and action. What will I eat? When will I shower? What times are my meetings? What podcasts and books will I listen to on my drive? What do I want to feel at the end of the day?

That's self-care.

When you start to feel bad that you are last on your list...don't. Waste of time.

Take a look at what you might be doing now that IS for you. Game your brain. Stop telling yourself that just makes you feel terrible. Heck, I count doing dishes and getting coffee ready as self-care. One, I love me a clean dish to eat off of. Two, I really like that coffee waiting on me like a sweet friend each morning.

I challenge you to ask one question of yourself? How can I care for me today? Get creative momma!

Don't play victim to life. How you respond to your life is your responsibility.

In our podcast today you will hear a lot about how we care for ourselves. I share a story about Logan and start bawling. Warning! And poor Kathy didn't know it was coming. I swear she looked at me and was like, "Holy crap! I think I have to take over the podcast." LOL.

¬†

item.title: Can I Drink and Lose Weight?
item.itunes:title: Can I Drink and Lose Weight?
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

¬†

¬†

If you want to lose weight and drink there are a few things you must know.

First, keeping up your current booze habit is no different than saying I want to eat cake and lose weight.

You CAN have wine and you can have cake...

But you CAN'T have either of them or both whenever you want. That's the real problem. Are you having cake and booze when you want it or when you plan it?

The best way I know how to teach you to lose weight is to do these THREE SIMPLE things:

Know what you are eating and drinking.
Before you give up food and alcohol get real about what you currently eat, how often, when, and why. When you have this information you are READY to move to the next step.

Decide when you will have eat and drink things you know SLOW down weightloss. Decide, plan, commit, and no extras.
That means if you plan three glasses of wine Friday and Saturday you don't get a fourth and you surely don't get it on Wednesday when the day was bad.

Assess your week.
We all want to lose weight and we all want to do it in a way we can keep eating and drinking the way we like.

That's not ever going to work. Sorry.

But, you don't have to "give up" everything you love. If you want to keep booze you can. You just have to plan it and when you weigh in each week you get to decide if the results are what you want. If not, you choose to plan less. If they are, you choose to keep on track.

Nowhere in here you are deprived. It's just you planning, committing, assessing and choosing. That's it.

I go deeper into how I've gone from drinking three nights a week to once a week (without tons of deprivation and crying)...and seen an extra 5lbs of booze bloat naturally go away the last couple of months.

I, too, was in the trap of drinking when I wanted and wondering why I was up 8lbs! LOL. Yes. Me!

The podcast is pretty honest about how even 13 years into maintenance I can get sloppy. But, I also teach you how I decided to get my act together in an honest way that taught me good habits. And when I teach me I teach YOU, too.

¬†

¬†

item.title: How to Quit Dreading Weighing Yourself!
item.itunes:title: How to Quit Dreading Weighing Yourself!
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†¬†

Do you ever dread weighing yourself?

I had a PNPTribe member call weighing in an "emotional rollercoaster."

When you weigh in you do you know what you are ACTUALLY weighing? Probably not. If you did then you would have zero problems getting on that scale no matter how you showed up with food this week.

Your issue might be you are weighing your self-judgement. That's a waste of time. Ever thought these things?

"I'll never lose weight."

"OOOHHH I was so good this week!!!!"

"I lost 2lbs. but I have like 78lbs. to go."

"I lost 2lbs. so tonight I can have that extra margarita and chips."

That's weighing your self-judgement. You are weighing how you think about that number instead of the your body weight. Those thoughts are not helpful.

Here's what you must know...

When you weigh the only thing the scale reflects is your fat, muscle, water, and organs.
Each of those are responding to hormones, your actions, and the barometric pressure.

Yes, weather and the temperature of the room you weigh in can move the number up or down a pound or two.

That's why shaming yourself is USELESS! What if you decide you are a failure and chug a doughnut after a good week because the bathroom was two degrees cooler than last week?

Did you just go "Oh no!" Girl, I've been there, too.

The most important thing to do prior to weighing (besides getting naked after you poop) is to think, "No matter what I weigh I will take an honest look at how I ate this past week."
This is the REAL DEAL. Your weigh-in must be a trigger you to honestly assess what went RIGHT and what you can improve this week. That's how you will lose weight FAST. Not with crazy shakes. With knowledge.

Your weight should NOT ever be a trigger to cry, shame, or eat. That's USELESS.

I want you to become a master at feedback. Why? The more you move into the mindset of appreciating feedback from your scale and food journals the more weight you will lose.

Losing weight requires you to get out of your head and into your details.

Our podcast dives deeper into this. We go over things we have our clients do each week to lose their weight FOR GOOD.

Eating in response to emotion is the most common way of overeating.

So often you don't realize that you are not physically hungry. You are comfort seeking, eating according to your schedule, or just plain eating out of habit.

Today we help you figure out when you are emotionally eating and help you with strategies to assess your hunger when you have the urge to eat.

item.title: Why "It's Not Good Enough" Kills Your Weightloss
item.itunes:title: Why "It's Not Good Enough" Kills Your Weightloss
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

Today I am going to get real about a thought I used to have all the time when I weighed 250lbs.

"This ___ isn't good enough to lose weight."

I cannot tell you how often I inserted things like water, leaving a few bites of my burger behind on my plate, or taking a 10 min. walk. And, then I would do freaking nothing wondering why I couldn't lose weight.

For years what stood in my way was a silly thought that what I could do was not going to be good enough. Today I will teach you how to quit doing thinking that crap.

I think people-pleasing is my most requested topic to discuss. People-pleasing is saying yes when you need to say no. It's also trying to be someone you aren't to control someone else's thoughts and feelings about you. At the holidays the people-pleasing mode goes into overdrive!

We people-please to protect ourselves. Today we teach you why it happens and how to start showing up in your life that's good for you and others.

item.title: Handling Holiday Food Pushers
item.itunes:title: Handling Holiday Food Pushers
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

If you are breathing and need to lose weight you have run into food pushers.

Our moms want us to have just a little more.

Grandma made your favorite dessert!

The husband thinks you can have pizza and it not turn into overeating.

Co-workers say you've been good all week so you deserve a cookie!

The big problem we have is that we don't want them to offer us food. Why? We don't want to be tempted.

Today we teach you how to allow them to offer food and how you can handle temptation, urges, and more.

By thinking ahead and planning for food pushers you will go to your holiday parties and dinners feeling ready and powerful instead of wishing it didn't have to happen.

¬†

¬†

I lost 100lbs and credit exercise to being the thing that taught me how to believe I could lose the weight. See, food is what ultimately gets your weight off but exercise was what inspired me to become more than I ever thought I could.

It built strength in my character, my drive, and my body. In this episode I tell you how I got started and why it meant so much to me.


I also answer some questions from others, like me, losing lots of weight and defying all the odds. From "Am I too old?" to "People tell me to quit" we get real about exercise.

item.description:

https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

Today we talk about why meal plans never work! And I'm talking about meal plans that you find online, get from trainers or out of books. We know those never work and we tell you why!

We teach you that the best meal plan for you is the one YOU create based on the foods that best fuel your body. You can't blame the meal plan, trainer, or exercise plan if you don't lose weight because your weight loss is based on the plan that you've figured out that's best for you!

Then we teach you how to own your decisions, how to own your choices, and own the way you think. Once you take ownership, change happens.

¬†

On today's podcast we talk about when to start and stop eating and also emotional hunger versus physical hunger. Calorie counting disassociates you from your body. This episode focuses on how to listen to your body - it will tell you when it needs to eat and how much food it really needs. And most of the time, it doesn't need near what you think it does!

Diets, calorie counting and meal plans have taught us to ignore our bodies' signals. We teach you how to take responsibility for what you put in your body and for how your body feels when you eat!

item.title: The Difference Between Feeling Hungry and Actually Being Hungry
item.itunes:title: The Difference Between Feeling Hungry and Actually Being Hungry
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

People write to me asking for help with all kinds of things. This week I took a listeners question: "What is the difference between emotional and physical hunger? How do you know the difference?"

I will tell you a key component to this. And, trust me, when you are able to cut out or back your emotional eating you WILL LOSE WEIGHT.

Most of us are eating for all kinds of reasons other than hunger. Things like you are afraid you will get hungry so you eat a little something, you are transitioning from the commute to cooking dinner so you grab a handful of chips, or it's been a long day and you need a little something to go to sleep.

Listen up because this recording could be a game changer.

¬†

Today we talk about a topic I‚Äôve been blogging about for years: Fat Girl Thinking or FGT. That‚Äôs the inner tantrum, that chick inside your head that moans about everything you‚Äôre trying to change or improve.

It‚Äôs also that voice that tells you how bad you look, how terrible you feel, and why you should stop trying to lose weight.

This podcast will show you how to start practicing thoughts that counter balance your FGT. You‚Äôll stop the chatter and learn to create new thoughts to shut down your inner bully.

If you think that if people would just act a certain way you'd be happier, you'd be thin, and the world would be a better place, then take notes! The problem isn't with them, it's all with you.

This podcast will show you where you are placing unnecessary expectations on others in your life to give you validation that you are making the right choices for you.

This podcast is going to teach you how to go from blaming lack of weightloss on "the world" to knowing how to own your weightloss no matter what.

If you want to lose weight then you MUST keep a food journal. It's the way you see what's working and what's not.

As I say in the podcast, "There are two people in the world who care about what you eat: you and your butt."

Don't miss this one if you are serious about losing your weight.

How much water do I need and why do I even need it? Count calories or not? Are macros important? Should I stop eating at certain time of day. item.title: Do I Have To Change EVERYTHING To Lose Weight?
item.itunes:title: Do I Have To Change EVERYTHING To Lose Weight?
item.description:
Get the Free Course here:
https://phit.click/freecourse

¬†

Today you will learn how to go from "Big Macs to broccoli."

Losing weight is not an overnight process. I teach you today how to avoid short-term fix diets to solve the long-term weight issues.

You'll learn my personal tips and tricks on how to make doable changes to your food when you eat out and how to get your brain PUMPED for the long haul. If you are looking for a quick fix this is NOT your episode. But if you want to NEVER lose weight again then listen up!

¬†

¬†
item.content:encoded:
